alert.note: Alert for Johnson; Washington; Wilkinson (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 06 at 8:30PM EST until January 07 at 9:15AM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Georgia... Oconee River near Oconee affecting Wilkinson, Washington and Johnson Counties. For the Oconee River Basin...including Penfield, Milledgeville, Oconee, Oconee, McIntyre, Irwinton, Oconee, Dublin, Mount Vernon... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast to continue. * WHERE...Oconee River near Oconee. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...Between 17 and 18 feet, Flood stage is maintained. The water level reaches the top of the Old Balls Ferry Road boat ramp...just upstream and rightbank from the Georgia Highway 57 bridge. Minor flooding of woodlands near the river occurs. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM EST Thursday the stage was 17.7 feet and falling. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:00 PM EST Thursday was 17.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is forecasted to fall below flood stage late tonight and continue falling to 8.3 feet Tuesday evening. - Flood stage is 17 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 17.8 feet on 12/26/2019. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
